processingRoutes.name: Acquisition of Home – no work required

question.text: Select on what grounds an exemption sought for not meeting meet the relevant borough Urban Greening Factor target scores

question.text: All developments of 10+ homes must submit data to the GLA’s ‘Be seen’ monitoring portal in accordance with relevant guidance
State the reference to planning application submission document containing Air Quality Assessment
All developments of 10+ homes must be at least Air Quality Neutral
Select on what grounds an exemption sought for all developments of 10+ homes not being net zero-carbon
Explain the 'Other' type of exemption in your answer

All developments of 10+ homes must net zero-carbon

questions.helpText: This must include at least a 35% reduction in on-site carbon dioxide emissions against Part L 2013 of the Building Regulations, of which there must be at least a 10% reduction from energy efficiency measures. Any shortfall in emissions must be paid into the borough’s carbon offset fund.

sections.text: The Sustainability Standards only apply to all the homes in the scheme, not just those funded by the GLA. Certify that the following Sustainability Standards will be met. Only in exceptional circumstances, where agreed by the GLA, will exemptions be made. These questions need to be completed before the start on site claim.

The Design Standards only apply to the homes funded by the GLA. Certify that the following Design Standards will be met. Only in exceptional circumstances, where agreed by the GLA, will exemptions be made.
Complete this block when you are bidding and review it before the start on site claim

question.text: Will all the homes include access to water supplies for firefighting in accordance with [Water UK’s national guidance document](https://www.water.org.uk/guidance/national-guidance-document-on-the-provision-of-water-for-firefighting-3rd-edition-jan-2007/)?
Confirm that these buildings include Automatic Fire Suppression Systems
Will all the homes with information about product registration, product recalls and electrical safety will be made available to residents?
Explain why the homes do not make information about product registration, product recalls and electrical safety available to residents
Are any of the following types of buildings funded as part of this project? (a) Purpose-built blocks of flats (including conversions) of any height (b) Supported and specialist accommodationn
Explain why the homes do not include access to water supplies for firefighting in accordance with Water UK’s national guidance document

Will all the homes with any in-built electrical products, such as white goods, will be registered with the manufacturer, where appropriate, and encourage residents to register white goods with manufacturers for every product where it is possible to do so?
Will all the homes be compliant with combustibility restrictions outlined the Building Regulations 2010, regardless of their height?

questions.helpText: External walls of all buildings (of any height) should contain only materials of Class A2-s1, d0 or Class A1 in accordance with BS EN 13501-1:2007+A1:2009

question.text: Explain why the homes do not have registered in-built electrical products, such as white goods
Explain why the homes are not compliant with combustibility restrictions as outlined in the Building Regulations 2010
Explain why purpose-built blocks of flats (including conversions) of any height or supported and specialist accommodation are not funded as part of this project
